1.content:
"Home Storyline" 
- To exterminate invading insects from the home, your dad uses a questionable bug bomb. Your mom and the girls leave with the pet cat to go shopping while you, your dad, and your brother remain behind to figure out the strange can of chemicals, unaware of what it truly is.

"High School Storyline"  (Sneak preview available)
- You spend the weekend at your parents' home, but a strange sickness shrinks you and you end up being unknowingly taken back to your old high school in your sister's bookbag.

"Job Storyline" (Not yet released)
- A free sample from a shady mall vendor shrinks you on your way to work.

"University Dorms Storyline" (Not yet released)
- After a wild night you can barely remember, you wake up in one of the campus dorms--but you've somehow shrunk overnight.

"Apartment Storyline" (Not yet released)
- After a month of surviving a strange incident which left you shrunk, your roommates have replaced you with a friend of theirs, who is about to move into your seemingly abandoned room.


Storyline Poll 
Which "Your Life: Shrunken 2" storyline would you like to see next?
      High School
      Job
      University Dorms
      Apartment


Survey on the High School Storyline 
I'm interested to know your opinions on my take of humor writing used in the High School storyline preview of "Your Life: Shrunken 2." I plan to write the entire storyline in this manner (unless it unexpectedly bombs), while writing the remaining storylines in my normal style. But, if you guys like the humor, I may make use of it more often.

1.title: Storylines

11.content:
The spider scurrying across the dining room is crushed between the wooden floor and the sole of your shoe as you stomp and smear it.

"They're everywhere," you say.

"I still don't know where they came from," Dad
Calvin, AKA Dad: The protagonist's father.
- Age: 45
- Occupation: Engineer
- Appearance: Short blond hair, combed back, slightly balding. Sky blue eyes. Tall, lean, broad shoulders. Usually wears button-up shirts, jeans, and hiking shoes.
- Personality: Calm, nonjudgmental, reserved, stern.
replies, examining a blank metal canister.

"How do you know that's even a bug bomb?" you ask him.

"I don't, but I'm not going to argue with your mother. We got it from one of her cousins, I think. They're a strange bunch--removing all the labels from things and such," he answers, adding, "Don't tell her I said that."

"Maybe you have to poke a hole into it."

He purses his lips. "I don't see how else we're even supposed to use this thing."

"How long will it take?" asks your younger brother, Bronson,
Bronson: The protagonist's younger brother.
- Age: 15
- Occupation: High school student
- Appearance: Mid-length, wavy, brown hair, with bangs. Mahogany eyes. Tall and lanky. Most often found in oversized T-shirts or hoodies, baggy jeans, and skate shoes.
- Personality: Quiet, distant, bright, unmotivated.
who is slouching in a chair at the table.

"I'd assume a few hours."

"What?" Bronson moans. He gets up and walks toward the stairs. "I'm getting some games then."

"Hurry," your father calls after him. Then he looks at you. "Can you grab me a screwdriver and hammer?"

Once he has the tools in hand, your father puts the canister on the floor and kneels beside it.

"I'm opening it, Bronson!" Dad calls. "Get your games and let's go!"

Then, Dad holds the screwdriver against the canister and hammers it to pierce it. Immediately the pressurized canister flies against the wall, spewing out a gray gas.

"Time to go," your father says to you. You stare at the canister for a second, thinking how unusual it seemed. Then, you follow your father to the stairs, where he was calling for Bronson.

The fumes from the canister act fast. They weren't really meant to kill the invading insects in your home. As you would soon discover, the chemical actually had the capability of shrinking humans.

Neither you nor your father see Bronson again before you both pass out from the fumes. Next to each other, you two tumble to the floor at the foot of the stairs--gradually shrinking to just one inch tall.

*** ** *** ** ***

You wake up to your father shaking you. Your head hurts, and you immediately clutch your temples. The world seems so bright, and as your vision focuses, you are not able understand what is going on or where you are.

"Good, you're awake," Dad says, turning away from you and looking around. You finally start to notice where you are.

For some reason, everything in your house is seemingly dozens of times bigger than normal. Your parents' living room is before your eyes, but you gaze out at it as if from the eyes of the very insects you had been trying to get rid of.

Then, your memory returns.

"Dad," you say, "the can..."

"Yeah, it seems that the gas from it must have shrunk us."

You stare at him as a new level of understanding hits you. It's not that the whole house has gotten incredibly large--you and your father have both shrunk. Looking around, you see that you are at the stairs going to the next floor, where you and Dad both passed out earlier.

"Where's Bronson?" you ask. "Is he OK?"

Dad frowns.

"I haven't seen him yet. But, he must be around here too."

At that moment, the front door of the house opens. Just a few feet to your left at normal size, it seems about a mile of white, plush carpet away now. Through the door comes Dani,
Dani: The youngest sister of the protagonist.
- Age: 13
- Occupation: Junior high school student
- Appearance: Shoulder-length, curly, blonde hair, with some curls straying into her face on occasion. Hazel eyes. Lean. Likes loose, colorful shirts or dark jackets, jeans or knee-length skirts, and usually either skate shoes or sandals.
- Personality: Bubbly, thoughtful, playful, hyperactive at times.
with the family cat, Mittens, in her arms.

"Is it safe for us to come in?" Dani asks. Behind her comes Mom,
Renée, AKA Renee or Mom: The protagonist's mother.
- Age: 39
- Occupation: Nurse
- Appearance: Long, wavy, brown hair, no bangs. Mahogany eyes. Average height and slim but curvy. When home, prefers sun dresses and bare feet.
- Personality: Cheerful, eager to please, talkative, but prone to mood swings when stressed.
who walks around looking for you or Dad.

"I'm not sure," Mom says. Then, she calls out, "Honey? Boys? Is it OK to come in?"

Your mom approaches you and your dad, unaware that you are both now only the size of insects. She stops next to the stairs, only a short distance from you. Her feet, tan from her love of being barefoot outdoors, remain in her light brown sandals--a rare sight when she is home. You are stunned by the enormity of your own mom at your new size. You may not even be much bigger than one of her clear toenails. She towers over you so that you must strain your head back just to look up to her face. From your spot on the floor, you can see the entirety of her legs, fit from her evening walks, all the way up her sun dress. You quickly look away but notice your father doing exactly the same. He recovers soon as well, however, when the severity of the situation returns to his mind.

"There's no way she can hear us at this size, this far away," Dad notes out loud. "And if we don't find cover..."

Finally, Jenna
Jenna: The oldest sister of the protagonist.
- Age: 17
- Occupation: High school student/athlete
- Appearance: Shoulder-length, straight, brown hair, no bangs. Sky blue eyes. Slightly taller than average, lean, athletic. Wears a wide variety of clothes but loves loose, thin, and comfortable shirts--often layered--along with tight jeans or sweats and either flip-flops, flats, or knee-high boots.
- Personality: Aloof, vain, talkative.
enters the house, closing the front door behind her.

"The truck's still here," Jenna tells the others without looking up from her phone. Her flats come off her feet almost immediately at the door, and she leaves them flung off where they fell. "Didn't you tell Dad to leave a note?"

Jenna walks towards you as well, and before you can even act, she walks past Mom--stepping right over you and Dad--and heads up the stairs to her bedroom.

Mom turns away and goes into the dining room, seeing the broken canister. She bends over and picks it up, but she does not see a note or any sign of you, Dad, or Bronson anywhere.

"Well, they opened the bug bomb," Mom says to herself as Dani walks into the dining room, still holding Mittens. "But why is the truck still here...?"

Dad turns to you as Dani passes by, fear in his eyes. You've never seen him this way before.

"We have to find cover right away," he tells you. "Once Dani lets go of Mittens, things will get bad in a hurry."

You nod, seeing Dani and Mom talking in the corner of your eyes.

"We don't have many options," Dad says, "but I think we should go _____."
11.title: Home Storyline

choices: "The best choice is to hide in her make-up bag."
"I think we can climb onto the end table."
111.content:
Dad starts making his way through the plush carpet, and you quickly follow. Glancing over your shoulder, you see that Dani is still holding Mittens. You wonder how much time you have left and if you can possibly make it to your parents' room before Mittens is let loose.

"You're going to try to get Mom's attention?" you ask as you wade through the thick fibers.

"Yeah," Dad says, without looking back. "Stay close to the wall, in case someone comes down the hallway."

"Do you think she'll be able to find a way to bring us back to normal?"

"I'm hoping so. It was her family's bug bomb, after all," he tells you. "Don't worry about that now, though. Focus on the problem at hand."

You nod, and at that instant, you are enveloped in shadow. You look up and jump in shock as you see your mom passing by, walking to her bedroom. She stops at the door and puts a hand against the wall to balance herself as she takes off her sandals. With them in hand, she enters the room.

"How will we make her notice us?" you ask Dad as you both continue your way through the carpet.

"I'm not sure yet. She won't stay in the bedroom long, though. She's just putting her shoes in the closet, and then she'll probably come back out."

Just as Dad predicted, a few seconds later, Mom leaves the bedroom. She passes by barefoot, completely unaware of her bug-sized family members on the floor.

"We should have plenty of time in the room to make a plan," Dad says. He then glances back, looking past you. "I can't see Dani anymore, but Mittens doesn't seem to be coming yet."

A few minutes later, you both reach the door to your parents' bedroom. The double bed takes up a large portion of the room, situated directly center on the opposite wall. Your parents both have an end table on their side of the bed, with lamps and other electronics. To your right, across from the bed, is a wide dresser. Further on, in the corner, is a standing mirror where you mom examines her outfit in the morning. The door to the closet is on the wall to your left, on the other side of the bedroom.

You follow your dad closer to the dresser, where you both should be out of harm's way for a while, in order to make a plan of action. You see that Dad is already studying the bedroom--from a perspective he must never have imagined he'd see--and you realize he's formulating ideas.

"What are you thinking?" you ask.

He responds, "_____."
111.title: Your Parents' Bedroom

1111.content:
"Her make-up bag?" you ask, confused. "Why?"

"When she goes to put on make-up, we'll be right at her fingertips," Dad answers. "This way, we'll let her come to us."

"Won't that take until tomorrow morning?"

"Do you have a better idea?" he asks. When you don't respond, he continues, "Let's go. We should be able to climb up the straps."

As Dad predicted, the straps of the make-up bag are perfect for climbing. The design leaves small indentations that you two can grip, and the angle at which the straps lie on the floor allow for an easy ascent. Once you two reach the top, you both grab hold of the unzipped teeth. Unfortunately, the interior of the bag is difficult to discern, and you realize that once you pull yourself up, you will likely fall either into or off of the bag.

"Don't worry," Dad says, noticing your apprehension. "It should be safe to drop into. Do you want me to go first?"

"No, I'm OK," you reply.

Then, you start to climb over the lip of the bag and drop in. However, you almost immediately fall against something inside, and you...
1111.title: Hiding to be Found

choices: Continue the story in your perspective
Shift the story to Dad's perspective
11111.content:
You have fallen onto a sticky substance from which you find yourself unable to get free. To make matters worse, Dad has followed your lead and dropped into the bag as well, though he has found his way to safety at the bottom.

"Son?" he asks, unable to see anything around him.

You peel your face free and turn your head in his direction.

"I'm stuck," you say, "to...something."

"That's not good," he answers. "Hold on."

He makes his way toward the source of your voice. A few seconds later you hear him again, now much closer.

"You sound like you're still pretty high up. Can you see anything?"

"No."

"All right. Well, I think I know where you are. There's something here. It's too heavy for me to move, though. You said you're stuck?"

"Yeah. I can't move at all."

"Hm..."

You feel a tremble through the object you are stuck to.

"Ah," Dad says. "I can't move this thing at all."

"What do we do now?"

Dad doesn't answer.

A minute passes by silently, and then all of a sudden you are sent flying around inside of the bag--yet still stuck to the object. What seems to be an earthquake has all of the bag's contents being bounced back and forth. After a few violent seconds, everything suddenly stops, but then something entirely different--and unexpected--happens.

With your sense of direction completely off kilter, you are looking straight forward through the open mouth of the bag, where the world has light, and far in the distance is your mom's face, looking down into her bag of make-up. Everything becomes dark again as she slides her hand into the bag, and you are startled when you find yourself suddenly jerked upward.

As soon as you leave the bag, you see your mom's gigantic fingers holding the object you remain stuck to. Then, as she turns it around, you find yourself staring directly at her pursed lips, which you are rapidly being moved toward.

In an instant, you are pressed into Mom's upper lip and slid across the width of it before being dragged again along her lower lip. This time, however, you are pulled off in the smear of lipstick applied to her bottom lip. From your new spot, you are yet again unable to struggle free, having been mashed and stuck into the lipstick. Your mom touches up her lip in spots for a few seconds before suddenly pressing her lips together, squeezing you between them. This movement spreads you out and leaves you face-down, with your limbs stretched out, upon her bottom lip. Gazing into a mirror, she cannot discern you from a clump of lipstick, but she feels your presence and tries to squeeze you into a thin layer with her lips. At this point, just before she accidentally squashes you along her mouth, you are broken loose and tumble free from her lips.

You fall straight down, and as you tumble the world flashes around you in a whirl. You are in the air for only a second, however, before you land on top of something soft and yet firm. You bounce off of it and start to fall backwards, but when you land upon it again you reach out and manage to grab onto something.

As you start to come to your senses, you realize that you are still with your mom, and she is moving. Then, you see her collarbones and shoulders above and before you, and higher still her neck and her face. She seems to have no idea of your predicament, looking ahead of herself as she walks. You then look back to what you are holding onto and see that it is the collar of her sun dress, right at her breasts. You have no choice but to hold on tightly, because as you look down you can see your mom's legs and feet as she walks through the house, and it seems to be about a half-mile drop to the floor.

As her miniature son clings to her chest, Mom leaves her bedroom and heads to the dining room. She stops near Dani and begins to talk to her.

"Ready to go?"

"Yep!" you hear Dani say.

Then, Mom turns and walks to the base of the stairs.

"Jenna!" she calls. "We're going to go out to eat now! Are you ready?"

For a moment, Mom stands still waiting for an answer, and you quickly make the decision to pull yourself up while you can. You've slowly been losing your grip as you've been hanging, so you climb onto Mom's breast and then hurriedly slide yourself legs-first underneath her bra, leaving only your arms, shoulders, and head exposed. For the time being, you are not only safe (and comfortable), but you also have a view of the world as Mom goes about her business. You consider calling out to her for help but decide to wait until a calmer time. Your heart is still racing and you've been dangerously close to death for a minute now. Plus, you fear catching her in surprise and being killed by accident. Better to wait until she's alone and relaxed, you decide.

Jenna finally answers as she leaves her room and heads downstairs.

"So you found the others?" she asks.

"Not yet," Mom tells her. "We're going to go out to eat anyway, though."

"What if they're still not back when we get home?" Dani asks.

"We'll worry about that later. Come on."

Still unaware of what happened in your father's situation, you hope he is safe as you are carried away out of the house with your mom and sisters.
11111.title: Stuck Like Glue

choices: "Why don't we do our nails together?"
11112.content:
Sliding off of whatever you first landed on, you drop to the side and suddenly plunge into a thick goop. As you struggle around in it, you only become further covered in the substance, and it smothers your hair and clothes, keeping your eyes and mouth shut. Panicking, you try to wipe your face clean, and you manage to get your eyes and mouth open.

Then, you are notice something else drop in beside you. You hear mutters and realize it's your dad. He clears his face as well, and soon you two look at each other--your eyes finally adapting a little to the darkness.

"You don't look so good," he says.

"What is this stuff?"

"Nail polish would be my guess. Just our luck."

You look up, and the bleakness of the situation hits you. The opening of the bottle is high above, and there is no chance of either of you two getting out of it.

"Dad? I think we're really screwed this time."

He doesn't answer. You look and see him staring up at the opening, a grim look on his face showing underneath the magenta polish.

"Don't lose hope," he finally says. "We'll get out of this alive, I promise."

There's nothing more either of you can do but wait.

*** ** *** ** ***

Several hours later, that evening, Mom is laying along the couch in the living room, watching TV. She has her bare feet propped upon one arm of the couch, her toenails bare. With an arm behind her head, she is absorbed in the show she's watching. At first, she doesn't even notice Dani talking to her.

"Mom."

"Huh?" she says, surprise on her face. "Were you talking to me?"

Dani stands nearby with an empty container of nail polish in hand.

"Do you have a purplish-pink color of polish?" she asks.

"Magenta, honey," Mom says to her. Then, she glances at her feet before saying, "_____."
11112.title: When the Fates Conspire Against You

1112.content:
"The closet?" you ask. "Why?"

"Trust me."

"But how will she see us if it's dark?"

"Don't worry about that," Dad tells you, starting on toward the closet without you.

Something seems strange about his behavior, but you follow him anyway. After all, you don't want to get caught by Mittens. As you push through the carpet, you wonder if that was Dad's idea, after all. Why would Mittens go in the closet? You two should be safe until you can get Mom's attention.

But...what if she didn't notice you two? Or something worse? What if she did notice you and Dad but mistook you for two of the bugs invading the house? You shudder at the thought.

Eventually, you and Dad reach the closet, and you are both thankful to be on hardwood floor. It is no longer a struggle to move around.

Inside the closet, the light is off, and it takes your eyes a few minutes to adjust. You simply follow your dad until you can see what is around you. It seems to be Mom's closet more so than Dad's. She has racks of shoes, all neatly organized, as well as hundreds of clothes hanging up along the walls.

"It might be a while now," Dad tells you. "We should be prepared for when she comes, though."

"What do you mean?"

You watch your dad as he paces around, scanning all of his wife's shoes.

"Unless she goes somewhere again today, she likely won't be back in here until she leaves for work tomorrow," he answers. Then, he turns to you. "I'm going to look around. Your mom will be back for her work shoes tomorrow. Stay here. I'll be back soon."

You are confused, but you obey. You sit down against the wall and gaze up at your mom's shoe collection. After a minute or two, you realize you don't know which way your dad went. You can't see him anywhere, but you don't think much more about it until at least an hour passes and he still hasn't returned.

"Dad?" you call out, standing up. You receive no answer. "Are you still in here?"

You start to worry. Nothing has happened in the past hour, but where could he be? Is he too far away to hear you, even just in the closet? You stop and think about what you should do.
1112.title: Mom's Closet

11121.content:
You start wandering, looking everywhere for your dad. You continue to call out for him, but you hear no answer.

Where has he gone?

As you are searching, a pair of shoes catch your attention. You recognize them as the sandals your mom had been wearing earlier in the day. They are brown with a white strap, and you can still see Mom's feet in them, completely dwarfing you at your new height.

You find that you have stopped and are staring at them.
11121.title: Where is Dad?

111211.content:
Curiosity gets the best of you and you approach Mom's sandals. Once you reach them, you gaze upon them in wonder. At the toe end of one of the sandals, you once again realize how much your size has changed. A simple pair of shoes lay before you, several times your size. You are only about as wide as the strap is thick. The sandals make your heart race, and you decide to climb onto one of them.

As you put your hand onto the flat insole where your mom's toes had only recently been, you find that her sandals are still warm from use. You pull yourself up onto the sandal and feel that they are still damp as well. In fact, her sandals have slight depressions from her feet, especially where her toes had pressed into the leather insole.

You breath in the smell of the sandal and let yourself fall flat upon it. You lay your face into the damp leather and stretch your arms and legs. For a minute, you simply relax and absorb the experience, taking in the smell, the feeling, and the unique situation.

Then, you roll onto your back and gaze up. You imagine your mom standing over you, still unaware of your problems. A mix of fear and excitement floods your mind as you envision her slender, tan foot being raised over you, covering you in its shadow. Then, Mom slips her foot into the sandal. First, she plants her toes behind you, over the heel portion of the shoe, as she enters the straps. Next, you find yourself being overtaken, and Mom unknowingly lays her toes over your tiny body. Damp and a little dirty from always walking around barefoot, her toes cover your body like warm pillows. Then, they push forward, and you are forced underneath the sole of her foot. It is incredibly warm and strangely comforting. You imagine the pressure is not overwhelming. Perhaps you can even stay here, remain her insole forever.

"What are you doing?"

You jump, startled. Quickly standing up and brushing yourself off, you see your dad standing nearby, arms crossed and watching you with a face of confusion and bewilderment. You feel your face flush with embarrassment.

"I...fell--was taking a nap. Here."

Dad does not answer, but he continues to look at you, as if searching your soul for the truth. You look away, unable to keep eye contact.

"That's definitely not the place to fall asleep, son," he finally says. "Come on. I've found a place to hide for the time being."

You follow him, feeling ashamed.

He takes you to where Mom keeps her work shoes. You immediately recognize her favorite pair--all-white converse shoes.

"If you're still tired, now's the time to get some sleep," Dad says to you as he sits down and leans against one of the converse shoes. "I'll sleep after you, and then I'll keep watch the rest of the night. We'll have to be quick in the morning. When she starts getting ready to leave for work, we'll have to be out in front of her shoes. From there, we'll just hope for the best."

You nod, still trying to forget your embarrassment. Dad says nothing more, and eventually you feel tired as you relax in the darkness of the closet. The last thing you remember before falling asleep is the sight of your dad staring blankly across from you, concern in his face.
111211.title: Mom's Sandals

111212.content:
Mom's sandals quickly fade from your memory. You keep looking and calling for your dad.

Eventually, however, you see movement in the distance. You aren't able to detect what it is, but you approach it. You stop calling for your dad as you come closer.

The movement seemed to have come from inside a pair of your mom's shoes. You sneak up to the shoe and find that the flip-flop next to it has been pushed up against it. Unable to see into the shoe at your height, you climb onto the flip-flop. Then, you climb up the strap of the flip-flop and peek into the shoe.

Inside, you see your Dad, who is trying to jump up and grab the lip of the shoe without success.

"Dad?" you ask, confused. "What are you doing in there?"

"Huh?" You see the surprise in his face when he hears you. "Uh, never mind that. I can't get out. I need help."

"How do I get you out?"

"Try," he begins, "letting down one of the shoe laces."

You climb onto the shoe from the flip-flop and start to tug at the laces.

"I can't get them loose," you say. "They're too tight."

"OK," Dad says. "All right. Um, give me a minute to think."

You try to figure out a way as well but come up with nothing.

"OK, son," he finally says. "Place your feet somewhere sturdy up there and reach down in here. Maybe you can pull me out."

You tuck your feet under the intertwining laces of the shoe and then extend yourself into the shoe. You reach out and you feel your dad take your arms.

"Hold on tight," he says.

However, you find that your dad is too heavy for you to pull up. Unfortunately, your feet also come loose in the attempt, and you are pulled down into your mom's shoe with your dad as well.

"Damn it!" you hear your dad mutter.

As you get up, you see what has your dad worried. The lip of the shoe is far too high for you guys to reach, even jumping.

There's no way out.
111212.title: Dad?

1112121.content:
The alarm clock on your mom's end table loudly jolts you awake. You mutter as you sit up--your sleep was very poor last night. You had fallen asleep laying on your side on the insole of your mom's shoe, but you had tossed and turned all night, unable to stay asleep for long due to lack of blankets and sudden fearful thoughts of what could happen to you.

Having nothing to do the day before but sit and talk with Dad, you two at least bonded as you waited for your mom to come. Neither of you knew what would happen, but you both remained optimistic. The unspoken rule was not to speak of Mom putting on the shoes you were both stuck in. But, you both knew it was a very real possibility. That, or being unable to get your mom's attention or get out of the shoe before you both died of starvation. There was no sense in discussing such morbid outcomes.

You can hear your mom groaning as she smacks the alarm clock. She is very comfortable in her soft bed, buried under layers of warm blankets. However, it is a work day, so she reluctantly slides her legs over the side of the bed and tucks her feet into her slippers. You can hear her yawn loudly, and then she leaves the bedroom and everything becomes quiet.

Dad is awake now too, and he looks as tired as you felt. Underneath his eyes are bags, and wrinkles you had never noticed now line his face. He seems to have aged significantly just overnight.

"Morning," he says to you, forcing a small smile.

But the reality of the situation is still imprinted on your minds. You are both hungry, sleep-deprived, and trapped in a near-hopeless situation. All that either of you can do is wait patiently for the narrow window of opportunity for escape that would eventually come.

Off in the distance, the sound of the shower meets your ears. It is strangely soothing to hear the pattering of the water against the tub. To your tired body and mind, it mesmerizes you. You know it must be about four in the morning--the time your mom normally wakes up on work days--and imagining a hot shower is incredibly relaxing. You sit against the side of the shoe in a daze for the next twenty minutes until the shower comes to a stop. Then it becomes quiet again, with the only breaks in the silence coming from the sink faucet being turned on and off as Mom brushes her teeth and readies herself.

"These are Mom's work shoes, aren't they?" you ask.

But, Dad doesn't answer. You believe they are; however, you also know she rotates shoes and has a few different pairs she likes to wear to work.

Eventually, you hear the dresser drawers opening and realize your mom is back. She is getting dressed and probably applying make-up. The early morning slowly drags on, and soon you unknowingly drift to sleep.

When you wake up, Dad is gently shaking you.

"Son, it's about time to wake up now," he says to you. "She should be here anytime."

Sure enough, Mom is finishing up her morning routine. As she enters the closet, you can hear her feet pitter-pattering against the wooden floor. You begin to tremble with fear. Dad, with his wits better about him, starts crying out at the top of his lungs.

"RENEE!! HONEY!! PLEASE HELP US!!"

However, his voice is drowned out by her own as she talks to Mittens, who finds Mom's socked feet absolutely fascinating and can not resist sniffing them.

"Stop it, Mittens," she gently tells the cat.

Then, she kneels down and reaches for a pair of her favorite work shoes. You and Dad both see her fingers enter the back of the shoe you two are in, and before either of you can cry for help again, she drags out the shoes she has chosen to wear to work and unknowingly topples you and Dad over inside of one of them.

12.content:
You stare out at the zoo through which you are being taken for a ride, trapped behind the black netting of a bottle pocket on your sister's backpack. Those black-haired boys slouching against the faded green wall of lockers seem to all have a nervous twitch which makes them fling their bangs away from their eyes. A girl nearby reeks of parking lot smoke breaks mixed with excessive cheap perfume, and her outfit suggests she already knows what she will be doing when she drops out from school. Why are those giggly cheerleaders barefoot? At least nothing will get between their developing breasts and mustachioed Principal Hackett's eyes, but a brigade of gun-wielding children could probably march by him.

You sigh.

When you graduated, you had vowed to never again come back to this miserable branch office of Hell. Is this your life now?

Jenna continues to walk through the hallway with her gorgeous best friend Alicia, blabbing away without any idea of your predicament. Maybe it was just temporary. If the illness had shrunk you down this small in just one night, maybe a day of rest would return you to normal. But could logic be applied in this situation? Who ever heard of a shrinking sickness in the first place?

A familiar face flashes before your eyes--at least, one that you are excited to see again.

Was that Ms. J.?

Being carried by Jenna, you only catch a glimpse of your former student-teacher. She must have been hired, you think. Ms. J. might be the only ray of hope in this hopeless school. A doe-eyed, brunette goddess with an absolutely perfect, lean physique and a heart-meltingly sweet smile. Not to mention so humble and insanely smart (she had a perfect ACT score in high school.) And her name was Hanna!

Ms. J. was the sole reason the spring semester grades of your entire sixth-period senior English class torpedoed so drastically. The guys couldn't keep their eyes or minds off of her, and the girls bitched jealously that the guys were no longer catering to their every whim. You were captivated by the creativity she showed with every unique outfit and hairstyle she came to school with each day, and she did all this when you could barely roll out of bed at 8 each morning! You had only barely graduated because your English grade dipped the warmer the weather became. The winter boots and scarves began to give way to flats and short skirts in the spring, and each new month revealed more of her body.

You return to your senses to find that everything is suddenly strangely dark. Were you daydreaming the entire day?

You look around, and in the distance high above and to your right are three horizontal lines through which light shines. It takes a second to process, but you realize that Jenna must have hung up her backpack in her locker. You don't even remember her leaving!

Having no desire to remain in place for the next eight hours, you decide to finally climb out of the side pocket. The netting reminds you of the cargo net on the playground in your elementary years. You awkwardly scale it and then peek over the edge, yet you can only barely see what is below. There seems to be a deep drop from your sister's backpack to the bottom of the locker, but months of returned homework assignments she plans to "someday" organize provide a padding at the bottom. You let yourself drop, feeling a bit anxious, but you safely land below, bouncing upon Jenna's bad grades.

Then, you walk towards the bent corner of the locker door. Quality has always been what Westwood High stands for.

You drop a short distance from Jenna's locker to the tile floor of the hallway and realize there's no going back. A late student walks by you, completely unaware of your tiny presence. The size of his converse sneakers alone as he passes in front of you is both frightening and remarkable. What a strange perspective. It would make for an interesting story if not for all of the danger.

You look around. The hallway is relatively quiet now. Nobody is in sight, but you don't care about him anyway. The only sounds come from the classrooms. The room you believe you saw Ms. J. in is a considerable distance away. The entrance to the cafeteria is right across the hall, and the gym is around the corner.

You suddenly realize all your options. At your size, things could get very interesting. As long as you aren't noticed by anyone, which was never a problem before, you could do almost anything you want!

You think. Where to begin?

125.title: High School Storyline Character Profiles

info.brief_description: Your life is forever changed when you shrink to just one inch tall. Can you stay alive?
info.description:
"Storylines" 

Jump to Story

(Tl;dr included at the end of each section for summaries of the following information.)

General Story Overview ▼

"Your Life: Shrunken 2" is what I call a situational survival erotic fantasy story written in the second-person narrative. I aim to encompass a wide variety of interesting circumstances for an average person whose life changes when he is reduced to a fraction of his normal height. I try to write "realistic choices," that is to say options from the protagonist's point of view. I believe this builds suspense and intrigue, rather than simply projecting what will happen in the next chapter. For example, a choice such as "Hide in her food" is both an "unrealistic" choice for someone in this hypothetical situation and makes for a protagonist who seems oblivious.

Similarly, I will write chapters with the idea of "realism" of death in mind, as well, and I would prefer additions to keep this element of the story going too, so as to have continuity with the rest of the story for the readers. What "realism" in death means to me is fairly self-explanatory. A shrunken person--in this case a one inch tall young man--is highly unlikely to survive being chewed apart, digested, stepped on, or many other scenarios common to shrinking fantasies. The protagonist might survive, but I will generally include reasons to maintain the "realism." To illustrate, perhaps the protagonist survives being stepped on by only coming in contact with the arch of someone's foot or having the impact reduced by carpet. Or the protagonist is swallowed alive--though in this case I would write in a death by digestion or suffocation.

Tl;dr: This story aims for "realism" in its choices and death scenarios. Please also consider this concept when adding chapters to maintain continuity.


Rules ▼

I do not spend enough time on this website to actively enforce rules, so I will only put forth suggested guidelines meant to make for the best possible experience for the reader.

* Additions with gay material, insertion, unbirth (etc.) are accepted. However, my own additions will generally only involve my interests--female vore and crush. With my understanding of this writing community, I anticipate much of the story will center around these concepts as well.

* Please follow the suggested format of unindented paragraphs with an empty line between each paragraph. In my opinion, this makes the reading easiest on the eyes, as it separates walls of text.

* I don't expect myself or other authors to be perfect writers, but I would ask for a decent effort if adding chapters. A good rule of thumb: "write what you would want to read." That said, I likely won't commit time to quality control, unfortunately.

Tl;dr: There are no rules, but I would prefer paragraphs be separated by a blank line. Also, please "write what you would want to read."


Character Profiles ▼

The following is a basic description of the initial main characters in this story. Within each of the different storylines I have included a section devoted to more detailed descriptions of the characters which appear in the selected storyline, which may be of interest to authors and some readers. Feel free, as an author, to make your own characters in the story as well.

All of the following characters are entirely fictional and not meant to represent anyone.

* You
The protagonist of the story, shrunk to just one inch tall.
- Age: 19
- Home: 3-bedroom apartment with two female roommates (Cassandra and Lily)
- Occupation: University student / Mall employee
- Appearance: Unspecified / Same as reader
(For reader immersion and the maintenance of the second-person perspective, the protagonist should not be referred to by any particular name. Nicknames or titles--such as brother--are welcome substitutes in tough writing situations. In addition, the protagonist should be male, simply due to the common demographic of this story's readers.)


* Calvin, AKA Dad
The protagonist's father.
- Age: 45
- Occupation: Engineer
- Appearance: Short blond hair, combed back, slightly balding. Sky blue eyes. Tall, lean, broad shoulders. Usually wears button-up shirts, jeans, and hiking shoes.
- Personality: Calm, nonjudgmental, reserved, stern.


* Renee, AKA Mom
The protagonist's mother.
- Age: 39
- Occupation: Nurse
- Appearance: Long, wavy, brown hair, no bangs. Mahogany eyes. Average height and slim but curvy. When home, prefers sun dresses and bare feet.
- Personality: Cheerful, eager to please, talkative, but prone to mood swings when stressed.


* Jenna
The oldest sister of the protagonist.
- Age: 17
- Occupation: High school student/athlete
- Appearance: Shoulder-length, straight, brown hair, no bangs. Sky blue eyes. Slightly taller than average, lean, athletic. Wears a wide variety of clothes but loves loose, thin, and comfortable shirts--often layered--along with tight jeans or sweats and either flip-flops, flats, or knee-high boots.
- Personality: Aloof, vain, talkative.


* Bronson
The protagonist's younger brother.
- Age: 15
- Occupation: High school student
- Appearance: Mid-length, wavy, brown hair, with bangs. Mahogany eyes. Tall and lanky. Most often found in oversized T-shirts or hoodies, baggy jeans, and skate shoes.
- Personality: Quiet, distant, bright, unmotivated.


* Dani
The youngest sister of the protagonist.
- Age: 13
- Occupation: Junior high school student
- Appearance: Shoulder-length, curly, blonde hair, with some curls straying into her face on occasion. Hazel eyes. Lean. Likes loose, colorful shirts or dark jackets, jeans or knee-length skirts, and usually either skate shoes or sandals.
- Personality: Bubbly, thoughtful, playful, hyperactive at times.


* Hanna Jorgensen, AKA Ms. J.
A former student-teacher of the protagonist, now a teacher at the school.
- Age: 25
- Occupation: High school biology teacher
- Appearance: Long, straight brown hair normally tied in either a bun or ponytail, with a few stray bangs in her face. Gray eyes. Slim, fit. Normally wears a sweater over a collared blouse, pleated skirts, and flats.
- Personality: Relaxed, happy, curious, quiet, but demanding and fierce when needed.


* Annalisa Francis, AKA Mrs. Francis
The protagonist's favorite teacher in high school.
- Age: 33
- Occupation: High school English teacher
- Appearance: Shoulder-length, wavy, scarlet-colored hair, with side bangs. Light brown eyes. Curvy and busty. Wears scarves, blouses, slacks, and heels.
- Personality: Flirty with a breathy voice, chatty, dramatic.


* Alyson Van Buren
The protagonist's boss at the mall.
- Age: 29
- Occupation: Mall Supervisor
- Appearance: Long, straight, brown hair with caramel highlights. Dark brown eyes. Fit, well-built, shorter than average. Frequently has on low-cut blouses, with or without a jacket, tight jeans, and either heels or ankle boots.
- Personality: Self-centered, confident, tactless, temperamental.


* Madison Thompson
The protagonist's favorite coworker at the mall.
- Age: 18
- Occupation: Mall Employee
- Appearance: Chin-length, straight, blonde bob hairstyle with bangs. Hazel eyes. Tall, lean. Either wears v-neck sweaters or collared blouses, mini-skirts or tan slacks, and sandals or black and pink athletic shoes.
- Personality: Quiet, shy, unemotional.


* Estela Vera
The protagonist's on-again, off-again girlfriend (currently not together.)
- Age: 19
- Occupation: University student
- Appearance: Long, wavy, brown-hair with side bangs. Flashy brown eyes. Average height, fit. Loves sun dresses or a jacket and yoga pants, and sandals, knee-high boots, or flats.
- Personality: Cheerful, confident, flirty, dramatic.


* Cassandra Miller
One of the protagonist's roommates.
- Age: 21
- Occupation: University student / Waitress
- Appearance: Long, straight, dirty-blonde hair, no bangs. Light green eyes. Fit, lean, athletic. In the apartment, wears oversized T-shirts or sports bras, sweats or shorts, and is either barefoot or wearing socks, with Ugg boots when away from home.
- Personality: Talkative, dramatic, playful.


* Lily Diaz Morales
One of the protagonist's roommates.
- Age: 22
- Occupation: University student
- Appearance: Long, wavy, dark hair, side bangs. Brown eyes. Athletic and busty. At home, wears loose, long-sleeve shirts, skinny jeans, and prefers socks, wearing either skate shoes or flats outdoors.
- Personality: Joyful, flirty, disciplined.


* Ashanti Harris
A friend of the protagonist's roommates, who is in the process of moving into his room.
- Age: 20
- Occupation: University student / Cashier
- Appearance: Chin-length, straight, black bob hairstyle with side bangs. Hazel eyes. Curvy, athletic. Relaxes in just a jersey and her underwear, putting on a sleeveless top, leather jacket, tight jeans, and ankle boots outside.
- Personality: Excitable, messy, playful.


Tl;dr: The above profiles are the condensed descriptions of the initial main characters. Authors do not need to know everything about the characters--I have provided these profiles for convenient use by those who want the information. You may also create your own characters, if you so choose.

For readers, it may be helpful to locate a specific character in order to learn more about him or her. Additional details can be found in the Character Profiles at the beginning of each storyline.


Feedback ▼

I most likely will not respond to emails, though I do read them and enjoy seeing new fans and ratings. Reviews are okay if they have constructive criticism or help me to improve the thread. Don't bother with negative criticism or unwelcome opinions. A lot of time has gone into this story with no expectation of any reward, so if there's something you do not like about anything involving this story, kindly do not read it.

Tl;dr: Feedback is welcome, but I probably won't respond--especially if you are negative.


Comments ▼

I hope you enjoy "Your Life: Shrunken 2," both as a reader and, hopefully, a contributing author. I have put together a story based on my previous experience as an author on this website and by seeing what makes other stories like mine popular.

That said, I am by no means a constant presence on this website. This story is yours as much as it is mine. It will go as far as we take it. Hopefully it reaches the potential I believe it has.

Thanks for reading!
